# elizaOS Tweet Ideas

1. streaming avatars is now seamless with jin's headless chrome + gpu support for rtmp endpoints. reliable 24/7 3d simulations with live chat integration coming soon

2. token migration portal has officially launched. 1 AI16Z = 6 elizaOS with a 90-day window until feb 4, 2024. migrate at your convenience—no rush, same ratio throughout

3. backend technical update: entity-level row-level security implementation nearing completion. strengthening data boundaries while maintaining performance

4. deal with X nearly finalized to recover accounts via backdated enterprise license. expected completion within 1-2 weeks

5. positive discussions with coinbase regarding potential listing. connection facilitated by gaia, more updates to follow

6. base deployment issues resolved with aerodrom team. lp provider now functioning correctly after initial launch delays

7. interactive 3d streaming container enables reliable 24/7 operation with plans to support multiple avatars and interactive shows

8. cross-chain bridging between evm chains (base/bsc/eth) under development. expanding interoperability across ecosystems

9. code implementation: normalized entity names array serialization for postgresql, ensuring reliable entity creation regardless of input format

10. containerized approach to streaming webgl applications creates reliable infrastructure for next-gen interactive experiences

11. unclaimed migration tokens? no problem—shaw confirms tokens won't be burned after feb 4 deadline. support tickets will be available

12. several exchanges already supporting the migration, with more coming online soon. cex users: check your exchange's announcements for details

13. dynamic prompt execution system merged: adapts contexts to prevent hallucination on lower-context models with validation/retry logic and performance metrics

14. addressing framework id confusion: improvements coming to clarify group creation and agent post triggering. simplifying the developer experience

15. technical progress on the horizon: parallel actions and background tasks in development to enhance core system performance and responsiveness

# Concise Twitter Thread

1. elizaos token migration is live. 1 ai16z = 6 elizaos, with a 90-day window until february 4, 2024. token swap is functioning smoothly across wallets and many exchanges, with more integrations being added daily.

2. technical achievement: jin has implemented headless chrome with gpu support for rtmp endpoints, enabling reliable 24/7 streaming of interactive 3d simulations with live chat integration. this containerized approach will support multiple avatars and shows in future updates.

3. business update: nearly finalized deal with x to recover accounts through backdated enterprise license. positive discussions with coinbase about potential listing. base deployment issues with lp provider have been resolved by the aerodrom team.

# Platform-specific Posts

**For elizaOS's technical audience:**
our dynamic prompt execution system now automatically adapts to model context limits. the implementation includes validation codes, retry logic, and metrics tracking with configurable caching and eviction policies. this reduces hallucination in low-context models while maintaining performance through schema-driven execution and token estimation.

**For auto.fun's crypto-native audience:**
migration vibes: ai16z → elizaos now LIVE 🔥 1:6 ratio means your stack just multiplied. 90-day window so no rush, fren. some cexs still implementing but most already active. found an arb opportunity between exchanges yesterday. shaw says no token burn after deadline, just support tickets. see you on base + solana.

2025-11-07.md

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-07

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration (AI16Z to elizaOS)
- Migration portal launched on November 6th with a 90-day window ending February 4th, 2024
- Conversion ratio: 1 AI16Z = 6 elizaOS tokens
- Migration was delayed initially due to issues with the LP provider on Base, but eventually launched successfully
- Users reported smooth migration experiences through the portal
- Some exchanges are still implementing the swap, causing temporary token disappearance from exchange wallets
- Shaw confirmed unclaimed tokens won't be burned after the deadline; users can create support tickets

### Technical Developments
- Jin implemented headless Chrome with GPU support to stream WebGL applications to RTMP endpoints
- The containerized approach enables reliable 24/7 streaming of interactive 3D simulations with live chat integration
- Plans to support multiple avatars and shows in the interactive streaming setup

### Business Developments
- Deal nearly finalized with X to recover accounts through a backdated enterprise license (expected in 1-2 weeks)
- Positive discussions with Coinbase about a potential listing, facilitated by a connection named Gaia

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: What is the ratio for the AI16Z to elizaOS swap?**  
A: 1 AI16Z = 6 elizaOS (answered by Natefrog)

**Q: When is the migration portal going live?**  
A: November 6th with a 90-day window until February 4th (answered by Burn)

**Q: What's the contract address for elizaOS?**  
A: It's available in the mirror.xyz article linked in announcements (answered by unfinished)

**Q: Do I need gas fee for token migration?**  
A: Yes, you need Solana for the migration (answered by multiple users)

**Q: Will AI16Z tokens on exchanges be automatically converted?**  
A: Yes, exchanges will handle the migration automatically (answered by Kenk)

**Q: Does it matter if I migrate now or later?**  
A: No, there's no explicit benefit to migrating early (answered by Mario)

**Q: Can I still buy AI16Z today and migrate?**  
A: Yes, you can buy AI16Z and migrate until February 4th (answered by 0xTDL ⚡)

**Q: Why can't I see elizaOS in my Phantom wallet after migration?**  
A: You may need to manually add the token in Phantom settings (answered by The Light)

**Q: What happens to any unclaimed ElizaOS on Feb 6th? It gets burned?**  
A: "Nah you just have to make a support ticket on Discord. Not gonna burn or mess with anyone, could cause fud" (answered by shaw)

**Q: So this lets you stream some talking avatar direct to pump?**  
A: "Or most streaming services really" (answered by Odilitime)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Phantom Wallet Token Visibility**
   - Helper: The Light
   - Issue: Multiple users couldn't see elizaOS tokens in Phantom wallet after migration
   - Resolution: Instructed to tap the 3 slider bars in Phantom browser, manage tokens, and set elizaOS to visible

2. **Phantom Wallet Connection**
   - Helper: MDMnvest
   - Issue: User couldn't find Phantom wallet to connect
   - Resolution: Advised to copy/paste the migration link in Phantom wallet for automatic connection

3. **Unstaking Transaction Errors**
   - Helper: old_visions & Odilitime
   - Issue: User getting "failed to simulate transaction" error when trying to unstake AI16Z
   - Resolution: Suggested trying on desktop instead of mobile and noted that despite error message, the transaction likely worked if tokens appear in wallet

4. **Portuguese Language Support**
   - Helper: Toni
   - Issue: Portuguese user's elizaOS disappeared from Phantom wallet
   - Resolution: Provided instructions in Portuguese to manually add the token

5. **Migration Delay Explanation**
   - Helper: shaw
   - Issue: Users confused about migration delays
   - Resolution: Explained that delays were due to LP provider issues on Base, which were eventually fixed by the Aerodrom team

## Action Items

### Technical Tasks
- Update dexscreener to properly display elizaOS token name instead of "UNKNOWN" (Mentioned by Mario)
- Complete token migration on remaining exchanges (Gate.io, Bitget, KuCoin, Bybit) (Mentioned by Eriksoon21)
- Implement cross-chain bridging between EVM chains (Enable Base/BSC/ETH <-> Base/BSC/ETH bridging) (Mentioned by gin_chan)
- Polish and push new build of headless Chrome WebGL streaming container (Mentioned by jin)
- Complete Base pool deployment fixes with Aerodrom team (Mentioned by shaw)
- Finalize deal with X to recover accounts through backdated enterprise license (Mentioned by shaw)

### Documentation Needs
- Create comprehensive guide for migration process with step-by-step instructions and screenshots (Mentioned by Multiple users)
- Publish official contract addresses for all chains as a centralized source of truth (Mentioned by JaiBo)
- Clarify exchange migration timelines with updates on when each CEX will complete migration (Mentioned by Multiple users)
- Create support ticket system for users with unclaimed tokens after migration deadline (Mentioned by shaw)
- Address confusion around framework IDs and clarify the system for creating groups and triggering agent posts (Mentioned by Amir)

### Feature Requests
- Add staking functionality for elizaOS tokens (Mentioned by imcryptor)
- Implement multiple avatars and shows in interactive 3D simulation (Mentioned by jin)
- Consider making containerized streaming an Eliza cloud feature (Mentioned by jin)
- Potential Coinbase listing following Base deployment (Mentioned by shaw)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-06

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration
- The migration from AI16Z tokens to ElizaOS tokens was scheduled to begin but experienced delays
- Several exchanges (MEXC, Binance Alpha, Gate, and Bybit) are supporting the migration with different timelines
- MEXC appears to be the first exchange to complete the swap for users
- The migration process involves minimal gas fees and will remain open for 90 days
- Tokens will be immediately tradeable after migration
- Community members repeatedly asked about migration procedures for self-custody wallets

### Development Updates
- Shaw submitted and R0am merged PR #5 to the otc-agent repository
- Development of a "login with cloud" SDK is underway to enable seamless authentication across multiple applications
- Plans to add an "Apps" section to Cloud where users can whitelist domains and link external apps
- Discussion about plugin-sql dependencies and requests to release the plugin-elizacloud plugin
- Sentry errors were dismissed as a non-issue from a single user

### Community & Promotion
- Coordination for promotional activities including a town hall featuring "Eliza agents"
- Plans to stream promotion for an OpenSea collection called "Art Decc0s"
- Discussion about Discord bot integration with ElizaOS
- Suggestions to improve project communication strategy and marketing

## Key Questions & Answers

### Token Migration
- **Q**: How do I swap AI16Z tokens for ElizaOS on exchanges?  
  **A**: Different exchanges have their own processes; check exchange announcements

- **Q**: Is there a decentralized migration option for self-custody tokens?  
  **A**: Yes, through the migration portal that will be announced

- **Q**: Will Bybit support the migration?  
  **A**: Yes, Bybit supports migration for spot trading

- **Q**: Do we need gas fee for migration?  
  **A**: Yes, but very little

- **Q**: Does the migration support Phantom wallet?  
  **A**: Yes, Phantom will be supported

- **Q**: When will trading start for the new token?  
  **A**: Depends on the exchange; Binance should be trading 7 hours after migration

- **Q**: Will the value of tokens change after migration?  
  **A**: The value of your tokens shouldn't change

- **Q**: How long is the migration window open?  
  **A**: Window is open for 90 days

- **Q**: Will migrated tokens be tradeable right away?  
  **A**: Yes, that's right

### Development
- **Q**: Can we release the plugin-elizacloud plugin?  
  **A**: Yes, just bump the package.json version to publish it

- **Q**: Is there a problem with Sentry errors?  
  **A**: No, it's just one user spamming a CORS error from a weird browser, elizaos works fine

- **Q**: How should I deploy a Discord bot?  
  **A**: Use plugin-discord, and visit discord.com/developers/ for setting up keys

## Community Help & Collaboration

- **Toni helped AlexZ** with correct information about Bybit supporting the migration, providing a link to Bybit's announcement
- **Burn helped Mario** by explaining that Phantom wallet would be supported, gas fees would be minimal, and the migration window would be open for 90 days
- **MDMnvest helped Muslim_Man** by explaining they need to wait for the migration portal and stay tuned to announcements
- **Figure helped KarshalQ** by directing them to the migration help channel
- **Odilitime helped Figure** with Discord bot deployment, suggesting plugin-discord and directing to discord.com/developers for setting up keys
- **Shaw helped R0am** by creating PR #5 with fixes for the otc-agent repository, which R0am merged
- **cjft helped 0xbbjoker** by advising how to release plugin-elizacloud by bumping the package.json version

## Action Items

### Technical
- Implement migration portal for self-custody wallets (Mentioned by: cjft)
- Deploy liquidity pools for ElizaOS (Mentioned by: cjft, Burn)
- Create Discord bot integration with ElizaOS (Mentioned by: Figure)
- Deploy Discord bot using plugin-discord and configure keys (Mentioned by: Figure)
- Deploy Eliza on AWS (Mentioned by: Wes)
- Implement "login with cloud" SDK for cross-app authentication (Mentioned by: cjft)
- Release plugin-elizacloud plugin (Mentioned by: 0xbbjoker)
- Fix plugin-sql dependency issues (Mentioned by: 0xbbjoker)

### Documentation
- Provide clear migration instructions for different wallets (Mentioned by: Mario, Muslim_Man)
- Create resource explaining team structure and roles (Mentioned by: Broccolex, AlexZ)
- Develop non-technical explanation of token value accrual (Mentioned by: Broccolex)
- Create or share documentation about recent migration (Mentioned by: KarshalQ)
- Create new Docs site for Cloud (Mentioned by: cjft)

### Feature
- Improve project communication strategy (Mentioned by: Broccolex)
- Expand social media presence (Mentioned by: Broccolex, AlexZ)
- Add Telegram channels including Russian language support (Mentioned by: AlexZ)
- Coordinate streaming to promote Art Decc0s OpenSea collection (Mentioned by: Reneil)
- Add "Apps" section to Cloud for domain whitelisting and external app linking (Mentioned by: cjft)

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-05

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration (November 7th)
- The AI16z to ElizaOS token migration is scheduled for November 7th
- A migration portal will be available for non-custodial wallet holders
- Multiple exchanges confirmed to support the migration including MEXC, Bitget, Crypto.com, and Gate.io
- Some users expressed concerns about futures positions on exchanges that are delisting AI16z
- Market volatility was briefly discussed (40% up followed by 20% down)

### Technical Development
- Core release version 1.6.4 was announced
- Security concern identified with the `api/system/env/local` endpoint being accessible in development mode
- Bug reported requiring a temporary workaround in the eliza-cloud-v2 repository
- Issues with the otc-agent and plugin-thedesk module were discussed and resolved
- Brief mention of "10k elizaOS agents live" with a link to a Museum of Crypto Art project

### Tools & Resources
- Discussion about ampcode.com as a potential alternative to Claude Code
- Reneil shared information about a stream featuring "10 moca agents"
- Some hypothetical discussion about autonomous agents that could persist over time
- Interest expressed in infrastructure that would allow agents to maintain memories and assist with tasks over decades

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: Do we go to a portal after November 7th to convert to ElizaOS on chain?**  
A: Yes exactly. We'll introduce the portal URL from our official channels, so keep an eye on our Mirror. (answered by Kenk)

**Q: Anyone know if MEXC is doing the migration?**  
A: Yes they are supporting the migration. See labs-announcements (answered by MDMnvest)

**Q: I am holding Ai16z on Bitget what should I do now?**  
A: Bitget is supporting migration (answered by Toni)

**Q: I have all my assets on crypto.com, do they support migration?**  
A: Yeah, they're supporting it https://x.com/cryptocom/status/1985574934827921867?s=46&t=vpkLs81PC2m1VztJvg9fzA (answered by Toni)

**Q: Is it possible to migrate through solflare to ElizaOS?**  
A: Yes, there is going to be migration portal starting November 7th for Non custodial wallets. Follow <#1299473809166045357> (answered by Toni)

**Q: Why am I getting "Module not found: Can't resolve './plugin-thedesk'" error?**  
A: Stan provided GitHub links to the correct file location and a PR (answered by Stan ⚡)

**Q: Has anyone tried ampcode.com as an alternative to Claude Code?**  
A: Yes (answered by sayonara)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Token Migration Support**
   - Toni helped multiple users (Markhor, mrkevin, Taco) with migration questions, providing confirmation about exchange support and linking to official announcements
   - MDMnvest assisted several users (mike.garf, zkSam, Shaa07dy, Man Demm) by directing them to the comprehensive list of supporting exchanges and providing migration guidance
   - Kenk provided clear information about the upcoming migration portal

2. **Technical Troubleshooting**
   - Stan ⚡ helped R0am resolve an issue with the plugin-thedesk module in otc-agent by providing GitHub links to the correct file and a PR to fix the issue
   - 0xbbjoker shared a PR (#6134) and temporary workaround for a bug in the eliza-cloud-v2 repository

## Action Items

### Technical
- Create PR to disable api/system/env/local by default in dev mode for security (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- Merge PR for fixing plugin-thedesk import in otc-agent (Mentioned by Stan ⚡)
- Fix bug reported in PR #6134 (Mentioned by 0xbbjoker)
- Investigate if client breaks in production mode (Mentioned by Odilitime)
- Launch migration portal for non-custodial wallets on November 7th (Mentioned by Kenk)
- Address futures positions on delisting exchanges (Mentioned by Da Michl)
- Handle account issue (Mentioned by shaw)

### Documentation
- Maintain and update list of exchanges supporting migration (Mentioned by MDMnvest)
- Provide clear instructions for using the migration portal for non-custodial wallet holders (Mentioned by Toni)

### Feature
- Consider getting Eliza listed on Grayscale's assets under consideration (Mentioned by DorianD)

# Analysis of Discord Chat in 💬-discussion Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around the migration of AI16Z tokens to elizaOS tokens at a 1:6 ratio. The migration portal launched on November 6th, 2023, with a 90-day window ending February 4th, 2024. Users discussed the migration process across different wallets (Phantom, Solflare, etc.) and exchanges (Binance, MEXC, Gate.io, etc.). Many exchanges were still in the process of implementing the swap, causing confusion among users whose tokens temporarily disappeared from their exchange wallets. There were also discussions about contract addresses across different chains (Solana, Ethereum, Base, BSC), with some users sharing unverified addresses that others flagged as potential scams. The migration process itself was reported as smooth by those who completed it, with tokens being directly deposited to users' wallets. Some users debated whether to migrate immediately or wait, though there appeared to be no advantage to delaying migration as the 1:6 ratio remains constant throughout the migration period.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What is the ratio for the AI16Z to elizaOS swap? (asked by Amit gupta) A: 1 AI16Z = 6 elizaOS (answered by Natefrog)
Q: When is the migration portal going live? (asked by 𝗣𝗥𝗜𝗡𝗖𝗘) A: November 6th with a 90-day window until February 4th (answered by Burn)
Q: What's the contract address for elizaOS? (asked by Nick Gurr) A: It's available in the mirror.xyz article linked in announcements (answered by unfinished)
Q: How do I swap AI16Z to elizaOS? (asked by amosxh) A: Use the migration portal linked in announcements (answered by MDMnvest)
Q: Do I need gas fee for token migration? (asked by mehdipro) A: Yes, you need Solana for the migration (answered by multiple users)
Q: Will AI16Z tokens on exchanges be automatically converted? (asked by Trapshot) A: Yes, exchanges will handle the migration automatically (answered by Kenk)
Q: How can I bridge my elizaOS from BSC to BASE? (asked by A S I F😈⚡) A: Currently, the bridge is one-way from Solana to other chains (answered by gin_chan)
Q: Does it matter if I migrate now or later? (asked by aubrey) A: No, there's no explicit benefit to migrating early (answered by Mario)
Q: Can I still buy AI16Z today and migrate? (asked by CHAD) A: Yes, you can buy AI16Z and migrate until February 4th (answered by 0xTDL ⚡)
Q: Why can't I see elizaOS in my Phantom wallet after migration? (asked by Rafael_nature) A: You may need to manually add the token in Phantom settings (answered by The Light)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: The Light | Helpee: Multiple users | Context: Users couldn't see elizaOS tokens in Phantom wallet after migration | Resolution: Instructed to tap the 3 slider bars in Phantom browser, manage tokens, and set elizaOS to visible
Helper: MDMnvest | Helpee: tobot | Context: User couldn't find Phantom wallet to connect | Resolution: Advised to copy/paste the migration link in Phantom wallet for automatic connection
Helper: old_visions | Helpee: wlt.vibe 🧩 | Context: User getting "failed to simulate transaction" error when trying to unstake AI16Z from daosfun | Resolution: Suggested trying on desktop instead of mobile
Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: wlt.vibe 🧩 | Context: Error when unstaking | Resolution: Noted that despite error message, the transaction likely worked if tokens appear in wallet
Helper: Toni | Helpee: Rafael_nature | Context: Portuguese user's elizaOS disappeared from Phantom wallet | Resolution: Provided instructions in Portuguese to manually add the token

## 4. Action Items
Technical Tasks: Update dexscreener to properly display elizaOS token name instead of "UNKNOWN" | Description: Fix token metadata on DEXes | Mentioned By: Mario
Technical Tasks: Complete token migration on remaining exchanges | Description: Expedite token distribution to Gate.io, Bitget, KuCoin, Bybit | Mentioned By: Eriksoon21
Technical Tasks: Implement cross-chain bridging between EVM chains | Description: Enable Base/BSC/ETH <-> Base/BSC/ETH bridging | Mentioned By: gin_chan
Documentation Needs: Create comprehensive guide for migration process | Description: Step-by-step instructions with screenshots | Mentioned By: Multiple users
Documentation Needs: Publish official contract addresses for all chains | Description: Centralized source of truth for elizaOS addresses | Mentioned By: JaiBo
Documentation Needs: Clarify exchange migration timelines | Description: Provide updates on when each CEX will complete migration | Mentioned By: Multiple users
Feature Requests: Add staking functionality | Description: Users asking when staking will be available | Mentioned By: imcryptor

# Discord Chat Analysis for 💬-coders

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily focused on streaming and visualization technologies. Jin shared a significant technical achievement: implementing headless Chrome with GPU support to stream WebGL applications to RTMP endpoints (specifically PumpFun Live) within a Docker container. This containerized approach enables reliable 24/7 streaming of interactive 3D simulations with live chat integration. Jin mentioned plans to support multiple avatars and shows, suggesting a complex interactive streaming setup. There was also brief discussion about a pixel art MMO game where someone wanted to create an ElizaOS-themed zone. Additionally, there was a comment about the framework having too many IDs, causing confusion when creating groups and triggering agent posts.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: How can I make the agent reply on Discord, do I need to fork that plug-in with that feature? (asked by Figure) A: Unanswered
Q: Is this for clanktank? (asked by who) A: Unanswered
Q: So this lets you stream some talking avatar direct to pump? (asked by DorianD) A: Or most streaming services really (answered by Odilitime)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: DorianD | Context: Understanding the streaming capability of Jin's headless Chrome setup | Resolution: Clarified that the solution works with most streaming services, not just PumpFun

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Polish and push new build of headless Chrome WebGL streaming container | Description: Finalize the containerized streaming solution | Mentioned By: jin
Feature: Implement multiple avatars and shows in interactive 3D simulation | Description: Create interactive streaming with live chat integration | Mentioned By: jin
Feature: Consider making containerized streaming an Eliza cloud feature | Description: Integrate the reliable containerized streaming setup as a platform feature | Mentioned By: jin
Documentation: Address confusion around framework IDs | Description: Clarify the system for creating groups and triggering agent posts | Mentioned By: Amir

# elizaOS Discord - 2025-11-07

## Overall Discussion Highlights

### Token Migration (AI16Z to elizaOS)
- Migration portal launched on November 6th with a 90-day window ending February 4th, 2024
- Conversion ratio: 1 AI16Z = 6 elizaOS tokens
- Migration was delayed initially due to issues with the LP provider on Base, but eventually launched successfully
- Users reported smooth migration experiences through the portal
- Some exchanges are still implementing the swap, causing temporary token disappearance from exchange wallets
- Shaw confirmed unclaimed tokens won't be burned after the deadline; users can create support tickets

### Technical Developments
- Jin implemented headless Chrome with GPU support to stream WebGL applications to RTMP endpoints
- The containerized approach enables reliable 24/7 streaming of interactive 3D simulations with live chat integration
- Plans to support multiple avatars and shows in the interactive streaming setup

### Business Developments
- Deal nearly finalized with X to recover accounts through a backdated enterprise license (expected in 1-2 weeks)
- Positive discussions with Coinbase about a potential listing, facilitated by a connection named Gaia

## Key Questions & Answers

**Q: What is the ratio for the AI16Z to elizaOS swap?**  
A: 1 AI16Z = 6 elizaOS (answered by Natefrog)

**Q: When is the migration portal going live?**  
A: November 6th with a 90-day window until February 4th (answered by Burn)

**Q: What's the contract address for elizaOS?**  
A: It's available in the mirror.xyz article linked in announcements (answered by unfinished)

**Q: Do I need gas fee for token migration?**  
A: Yes, you need Solana for the migration (answered by multiple users)

**Q: Will AI16Z tokens on exchanges be automatically converted?**  
A: Yes, exchanges will handle the migration automatically (answered by Kenk)

**Q: Does it matter if I migrate now or later?**  
A: No, there's no explicit benefit to migrating early (answered by Mario)

**Q: Can I still buy AI16Z today and migrate?**  
A: Yes, you can buy AI16Z and migrate until February 4th (answered by 0xTDL ⚡)

**Q: Why can't I see elizaOS in my Phantom wallet after migration?**  
A: You may need to manually add the token in Phantom settings (answered by The Light)

**Q: What happens to any unclaimed ElizaOS on Feb 6th? It gets burned?**  
A: "Nah you just have to make a support ticket on Discord. Not gonna burn or mess with anyone, could cause fud" (answered by shaw)

**Q: So this lets you stream some talking avatar direct to pump?**  
A: "Or most streaming services really" (answered by Odilitime)

## Community Help & Collaboration

1. **Phantom Wallet Token Visibility**
   - Helper: The Light
   - Issue: Multiple users couldn't see elizaOS tokens in Phantom wallet after migration
   - Resolution: Instructed to tap the 3 slider bars in Phantom browser, manage tokens, and set elizaOS to visible

2. **Phantom Wallet Connection**
   - Helper: MDMnvest
   - Issue: User couldn't find Phantom wallet to connect
   - Resolution: Advised to copy/paste the migration link in Phantom wallet for automatic connection

3. **Unstaking Transaction Errors**
   - Helper: old_visions & Odilitime
   - Issue: User getting "failed to simulate transaction" error when trying to unstake AI16Z
   - Resolution: Suggested trying on desktop instead of mobile and noted that despite error message, the transaction likely worked if tokens appear in wallet

4. **Portuguese Language Support**
   - Helper: Toni
   - Issue: Portuguese user's elizaOS disappeared from Phantom wallet
   - Resolution: Provided instructions in Portuguese to manually add the token

5. **Migration Delay Explanation**
   - Helper: shaw
   - Issue: Users confused about migration delays
   - Resolution: Explained that delays were due to LP provider issues on Base, which were eventually fixed by the Aerodrom team

## Action Items

### Technical Tasks
- Update dexscreener to properly display elizaOS token name instead of "UNKNOWN" (Mentioned by Mario)
- Complete token migration on remaining exchanges (Gate.io, Bitget, KuCoin, Bybit) (Mentioned by Eriksoon21)
- Implement cross-chain bridging between EVM chains (Enable Base/BSC/ETH <-> Base/BSC/ETH bridging) (Mentioned by gin_chan)
- Polish and push new build of headless Chrome WebGL streaming container (Mentioned by jin)
- Complete Base pool deployment fixes with Aerodrom team (Mentioned by shaw)
- Finalize deal with X to recover accounts through backdated enterprise license (Mentioned by shaw)

### Documentation Needs
- Create comprehensive guide for migration process with step-by-step instructions and screenshots (Mentioned by Multiple users)
- Publish official contract addresses for all chains as a centralized source of truth (Mentioned by JaiBo)
- Clarify exchange migration timelines with updates on when each CEX will complete migration (Mentioned by Multiple users)
- Create support ticket system for users with unclaimed tokens after migration deadline (Mentioned by shaw)
- Address confusion around framework IDs and clarify the system for creating groups and triggering agent posts (Mentioned by Amir)

### Feature Requests
- Add staking functionality for elizaOS tokens (Mentioned by imcryptor)
- Implement multiple avatars and shows in interactive 3D simulation (Mentioned by jin)
- Consider making containerized streaming an Eliza cloud feature (Mentioned by jin)
- Potential Coinbase listing following Base deployment (Mentioned by shaw)

# elizaos/eliza Weekly Report (Nov 2 - 8, 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
This week's activity focused on initiating new features and planning for future enhancements. Development began on core security and runtime improvements, with new pull requests opened to implement entity-level row-level security and to add an ElizaOS reference to the runtime. Concurrently, several new issues were created to guide future work, focusing on core performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as user engagement with a points and leaderboard system. The period was characterized by laying the groundwork for upcoming features rather than completing existing ones.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
While no major features were completed this period, work was initiated on two key fronts through new pull requests:

-   **Security Framework:** A new pull request, [#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107), was opened to begin the implementation of entity-level row-level security (RLS). This work is complemented by a new issue, [#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112), opened for discussion on the same topic.
-   **Runtime Enhancements:** To improve the runtime environment, work was started in [#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111) to add an ElizaOS reference, a foundational step for future runtime capabilities.

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
No issues were closed this week. The focus was on opening new discussions to shape the project's direction.

-   **New & Active Issues:** Four significant new issues were opened, outlining key areas for future development:
    -   **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were started around improving the system's operational capabilities with proposals for "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)).
    -   **User Engagement & Security:** Future enhancements were proposed for user interaction via a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) and for data security with "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)).

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a focus on initiating new work streams through the opening of pull requests and issues. There were no specific details in the reports regarding high-volume discussions or collaborative reviews during this period.

2025-11-01.md

# elizaos/eliza Monthly Report (November 2025)

## 🚀 Highlights
November kicked off with a dual focus on enhancing system stability and laying the groundwork for significant new capabilities. A critical bug affecting agent settings persistence was resolved, directly improving the framework's reliability. Concurrently, new development was initiated to introduce entity-level security and enhance the core runtime. The opening of several strategic issues signals a forward-looking push towards improved performance through parallel actions and background tasks, as well as new user engagement features.

## 🛠️ Key Developments
Work this month balanced immediate fixes with the introduction of new features.

- **Agent Stability Improvement**
  A significant bug was fixed that prevented agent settings from persisting across restarts, ensuring that runtime-generated configurations are now correctly retained. This change, made to the core runtime initialization logic, enhances the overall reliability of agent operations ([#6106](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6106)).

- **New Feature Initiatives**
  Development began on several new fronts with the opening of new pull requests:
  - **Security:** A proposal was made to implement entity-level row-level security, aiming to add more granular data access controls ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)).
  - **Runtime Enhancements:** Work started on adding an ElizaOS reference directly to the runtime, likely to streamline framework interactions ([#6111](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6111)).

## 🐛 Issues & Triage
Issue tracking this month was focused on defining the next wave of development priorities.

- **Closed Issues:** No issues were closed during this period.

- **New & Active Issues:** Several key issues were opened, outlining major areas for future work:
  - **Core Functionality & Performance:** Discussions were initiated around implementing "Parallel actions" ([#6108](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6108)) and "Background tasks" ([#6109](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6109)), indicating a focus on scaling the system's operational capacity.
  - **Security & User Engagement:** New issues were created for "Entity-level RLS" ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)), which complements the ongoing PR, and a "Points / Leaderboard" system ([#6110](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6110)) to enhance user interaction.
  - According to the reports, none of the active issues have generated more than three comments, suggesting discussions are still in their early stages.

## 💬 Community & Collaboration
The provided reports indicate a period of focused, heads-down development. While new pull requests and issues were opened, the data does not show any high-volume discussions or specific collaborative events. The alignment between the new pull request for RLS ([#6107](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/pull/6107)) and the corresponding new issue ([#6112](https://github.com/elizaos/eliza/issues/6112)) suggests coordinated planning around new features.

      "number": 6093,
      "body": "## Overview\n\nThis PR introduces a new **** package containing headless, reusable React hooks extracted from the client package. This enables external developers to build custom UIs for ElizaOS agents while maintaining full type safety and React Query integration.\n\n## What's New\n\n### Package: \n\nA standalone package providing headless React hooks with:\n- ✅ Zero UI coupling (no toasts, navigation, or DOM dependencies)\n- ✅ Full TypeScript support with proper type declarations\n- ✅ TanStack React Query for caching and state management\n- ✅ Network-aware polling that adapts to connection quality\n- ✅ Composable lifecycle callbacks (onSuccess, onError, onMutate)\n\n### Hooks Included (30 total)\n\n**Agents (8 hooks)**\n- `useAgents`, `useAgent`, `useStartAgent`, `useStopAgent`\n- `useAgentActions`, `useDeleteLog`, `useAgentPanels`, `useAgentsWithDetails`\n\n**Runs (2 hooks)**\n- `useAgentRuns`, `useAgentRunDetail`\n\n**Messaging (5 hooks)**\n- `useServers`, `useChannels`, `useChannelDetails`, `useChannelParticipants`, `useDeleteChannel`\n\n**Messages (3 hooks)**\n- `useChannelMessages` (stateful with pagination), `useDeleteChannelMessage`, `useClearChannelMessages`\n\n**Memories (6 hooks)**\n- `useAgentMemories`, `useDeleteMemory`, `useDeleteAllMemories`, `useUpdateMemory`, `useDeleteGroupMemory`, `useClearGroupChat`\n\n**Internal/Agent-Perspective (6 hooks)**\n- `useAgentInternalActions`, `useDeleteAgentInternalLog`, `useAgentInternalMemories`\n- `useDeleteAgentInternalMemory`, `useDeleteAllAgentInternalMemories`, `useUpdateAgentInternalMemory`\n\n## Architecture\n\n```tsx\nimport { QueryClient, QueryClientProvider } from '@tanstack/react-query';\nimport { ElizaReactProvider, useAgents, useStartAgent } from '@elizaos/react';\n\nconst queryClient = new QueryClient();\n\nfunction App() {\n  return (\n    <QueryClientProvider client={queryClient}>\n      <ElizaReactProvider baseUrl=\"http://localhost:3000\">\n        <AgentList />\n      </ElizaReactProvider>\n    </QueryClientProvider>\n  );\n}\n\nfunction AgentList() {\n  const { data: agents, isLoading } = useAgents();\n  const startAgent = useStartAgent({\n    onSuccess: () => toast.success('Agent started!'),\n  });\n\n  if (isLoading) return <div>Loading...</div>;\n\n  return (\n    <div>\n      {agents?.map((agent) => (\n        <div key={agent.id}>\n          <h3>{agent.name}</h3>\n          <button onClick={() => startAgent.mutate(agent.id)}>\n            Start\n          </button>\n        </div>\n      ))}\n    </div>\n  );\n}\n```\n\n## Benefits\n\n1. **Reusability**: External developers can build custom UIs using these hooks\n2. **Type Safety**: Full TypeScript support with types from `@elizaos/api-client`\n3. **Performance**: Smart polling adapts to network quality (2G → 4G)\n4. **Separation of Concerns**: UI logic stays in components, data logic in hooks\n5. **Future-proof**: Ready for migration of `packages/client` to consume these hooks\n\n## Testing\n\n- ✅ Package builds successfully with TypeScript declarations\n- ✅ All hooks properly typed with React Query v5 signatures\n- ✅ Zero build errors or type issues\n- ✅ Ready for integration into turbo build pipeline\n\n## Next Steps (Future PRs)\n\n- Migrate `packages/client` to consume `@elizaos/react`\n- Add unit tests for hooks with mocked ElizaClient\n- Publish to npm for external consumption\n\n## Files Changed\n\n- `packages/react/` - New package with provider, hooks, and documentation\n- Comprehensive README with installation, API reference, and examples\n\n---\n\n**Ready for review!** 🚀\n\n<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->\n---\n\n> [!NOTE]\n> Introduces a new `@elizaos/react` package with headless, type-safe React hooks and provider (plus build/docs), integrates it into the workspace, and publishes comprehensive core type declarations.\n> \n> - **New package `@elizaos/react`**:\n>   - Headless React hooks and provider (`ElizaReactProvider`) built on `@tanstack/react-query` and `@elizaos/api-client`.\n>   - Hooks for: agents, runs, messaging (servers/channels), messages (stateful + pagination), memories, and internal agent-perspective operations.\n>   - Network-aware polling, composable mutation callbacks, TypeScript types, and index exports.\n>   - Build tooling (`build.ts`, bunfig, tsconfigs), and comprehensive README.\n> - **Workspace integration**:\n>   - Added to lockfile/workspace with       "title": "feat: Framework for adjusting prompts to best fix model contexts",
      "author": "odilitime",
      "number": 6113,
      "body": "# Risks\r\n\r\nLow, new feature, uses some memory but I put configurable limit on it\r\n\r\n# Background\r\n\r\n## What does this PR do?\r\n\r\nIt add a dynamic prompt execution system\r\n\r\n## What kind of change is this?\r\n\r\nFeatures (non-breaking change which adds functionality)\r\n\r\n## Why are we doing this? Any context or related work?\r\n\r\nPeople may use models with lower context and get hallucination, this helps detect when the context is blown out.\r\n\r\n# Documentation changes needed?\r\n\r\nMy changes require a change to the project documentation.\n\n<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->\n---\n\n> [!NOTE]\n> Introduces a schema-based dynamic prompt executor with validation/retries/metrics and replaces ad-hoc prompting in message flows, plus supporting types/utils and test updates.\n> \n> - **Core Runtime**:\n>   - Add `runtime.dynamicPromptExecFromState(...)` for schema-driven prompt execution (XML/JSON parsing, UUID validation codes, retries, Handlebars state injection, token estimations).\n>   - Track execution metrics via `modelSchemaMetrics` and `modelMetrics` with optional LRU eviction (`DYNAMIC_PROMPT_MAX_ENTRIES`) and retry policy (`VALIDATION_LEVEL`).\n>   - Expose metrics getters/clearers; helper methods for cache/keys; minor logging adjustments.\n> - **Message Service**:\n>   - Replace manual `useModel` + XML parsing with `dynamicPromptExecFromState` in:\n>     - `shouldRespond` evaluation (small model).\n>     - Single-shot handler (requires `thought`, `actions`).\n>     - Multi-step decision loop and final summary.\n>   - Improve error logging and minor flow tweaks.\n> - **Types/Utils**:\n>   - Export `SchemaRow` and `State` from `types`; extend `IAgentRuntime` with `dynamicPromptExecFromState`.\n>   - Export `upgradeDoubleToTriple` and `composeRandomUser` from `utils`.\n> - **Tests/Test Utils**:\n>   - Update `message-service` tests to mock `dynamicPromptExecFromState` responses.\n>   - Add mock implementation in test runtime; minor logger formatting changes.\n> \n> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 5905b5f9ab86dd7b7d727d92060575f42a8fc707. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>\n<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->",
